page.title: 15COLLINS FARM HIGH LAVER
page.content: Mr Collins grows crops and he also has a herd of 52O Freisian bulls which he keeps for beef. Every 8 months he buys 5O calves age 3 months and he sells them at a year old for beef. They are fed with a special food mix which is made on the farm. The cattle are kept in pens according to their age. Any sick animals are taken out of the pens and put into a seperate barn to prevent the spread of disease. Mr. Collins employs 6 farm workers; 1 stockman and 5 landworkers. At harvest time he takes on extra labour on a casual basis. The farm has 12 tractors, 2 combine harvesters, ploughs, a grading machine and cooling machine for the potatoes and a dryer for the grain crops.
